item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' proccess that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculates as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculates as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculates as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

item_prototype.name: ACKFailureCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when an ACK is not received when expected.

item_prototype.name: FailedCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when an MSDU is not transmitted successfully due to the number of transmit attempts exceeding either the dot11ShortRetryLimit or dot11LongRetryLimit.

item_prototype.name: FCSErrorCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when an FCS error is detected in a received MPDU.

item_prototype.name: FrameDuplicateCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when a frame is received that the Sequence Control field indicates is a duplicate.

item_prototype.name: MultipleRetryCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when an MSDU is successfully transmitted after more than one retransmission.

item_prototype.name: ReceivedFragmentCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented for each successfully received MPDU of type Data or Management.

item_prototype.name: RetryCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when an MSDU is successfully transmitted after one or more retransmissions.

item_prototype.name: RTSFailureCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when a CTS is not received in response to an RTS.

item_prototype.name: RTSSuccessCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments when a CTS is received in response to an RTS.

item_prototype.name: TransmittedFragmentCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter is incremented for an acknowledged MPDU with an individual address in the address 1 field or an MPDU with a group address in the address 1 field of type Data or Management.

item_prototype.name: TransmittedFrameCount ({#PHY})
item_prototype.description: This counter increments for each successfully transmitted MSDU.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Busy time on channel {#FREQ} on {#DEV} is high

trigger.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Configured max number of processes is too low on {HOST.NAME}
I/O are overloaded on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

trigger.name: Lack of available memory on router {HOST.NAME}
Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}
Radius server not configured
trigger.description: Radius server not configured - need to restart wifi
